noun.description: The opinion generally held of someone or something; the state of being generally regarded in a particular way.
examples: pollution could bring the authority's name into bad repute

verb.description: Be generally said or believed to do something or to have particular characteristics.
examples: he was reputed to have a fabulous house

origin: Late Middle English: from Old French reputer or Latin reputare think over, from re- (expressing intensive force) + putare think.
